alert.note: Alert for Clark; Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 01 at 3:01AM CDT until April 01 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Snow Continues Early This Morning... .A band of snow persists early this morning from parts of northern Iowa and southeast Minnesota through northern Wisconsin with many roads across southeast Minnesota into northern Wisconsin snow-covered. Accidents and spinouts have been reported. Snowfall rates up to 2 inches per hour are possible across parts of north- central Wisconsin for a time early this morning before snow begins to taper off through sunrise. Localized power outages or tree damage could occur due to the wet nature of the snow. Exercise extreme caution if you must travel early today. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, highest across parts of Clark County. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Clark and Jackson Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
